intro: Gynheteria incana, commonly known as the silverleaf mallow, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its silvery-gray foliage due to dense pubescence. The plant produces showy, pale pink to white flowers that bloom in clusters during the dry season. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands or grasslands. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both horticultural and ecological studies.
